Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mastoparan V1 (MP-V1, Lys-rich; Ile-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of THE PEPTIDE shows 58.8% similarity toLasioglossin LL-II. molecular formula:C81H143N20O19S1; M.W. 1758.191; GRAVY: -0.053; The Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity: 1.95 kcal/mol; molar extinction coefficient: 5550.Structure:  Helical in 8mM SDS or 40% TFE.Activity: Active against S. mutans, S. enterica, and S. aureus (MIC 50 uM), and C. albicans, C. grabrata (MIC 50 uM), and C. neoformans (MIC 0.5 uM).Toxicity:  Weak hemolysis 6.6% at 50 uM (20% at 100 uM). More hemolytic than MP-L, MP-B and MP-X.
Literature Information.Author: Kim Y, Son M, Noh EY, Kim S, Kim C, Yeo JH, Park C, Lee KW, Bang WY.2016
Literature Information.Title: MP-V1 from the Venom of Social Wasp Vespula vulgaris Is a de Novo Type of Mastoparan that Displays Superior Antimicrobial Activities.
